type_data.description: These days, some blogs are more influential than TV and newspapers combined. Get them on your side! Organize an event and invite some blogosphere celebrities. Cool, exclusive location, extravagant buffet, hip DJ – and tell them you value their opinion. They’ll be eating out of your hands in no time.
type_data.label: Organize blogger event
type_data.title: Organize blogger event

type_data.description: Corporate Social Responsibility. Sounds really neat, right? And it’s pretty easy, too: Just donate some money to help sick children or to fight famine in developing countries. Politicians and media will think twice before they criticize you again!
type_data.label: CSR Campaign
type_data.title: CSR Campaign

type_data.description: Hire a very special man to clean up your bad image. He’s powerful, cynical, and cunning. He loves his command centers to look like something straight out of Star Trek. He knows the real players – and how to use them to your advantage.
type_data.label: Former intelligence boss
type_data.title: Former intelligence boss

type_data.description: Organize a conference and invite all those renowned professors from elite universities to give presentations. Won’t be easy, but here’s the thing: Just tell them everyone else has already accepted, and vice versa. In the end, they’ve got another paper presented at a prestigious event – and you’ve got them all in your pocket.
type_data.label: Organize conference
type_data.title: Organize conference

type_data.description: Lobbying is the supreme discipline when it comes to influencing public opinion. And there’s professionals who know how best to sell your interests to the right people. Whether it’s some inconvenient legislation or you’re threatened by actual law enforcement – good lobbying can solve all sorts of problems.
type_data.label: Lobbying
type_data.title: Lobbying

type_data.description: The basis for keeping up appearances is taking good care of your network. Visit promising events, be nice to the right people, and scratch their backs a little – who knows, you might need them to return the favor some day.
type_data.label: Networking
type_data.title: Networking

type_data.description: The best way to deal with negative press? Give them something nice to talk about instead! Invite journalists on fancy trips, pay for their drinks and hand out goodies. People love receiving little presents – and it might just make them like you as well.
type_data.label: Giveaways for journalists
type_data.title: Giveaways for journalists

type_data.description: Scientists are always in desperate need of funding. Just get some university contacts and commission an in-depth study. Of course you’re only paying for research that favors your position. Maybe include some minor criticism to make it more believable, but not too much – or you’re taking your money elsewhere.
type_data.label: Study funding
type_data.title: Study funding/Fund a study/Paid research

type_data.description: A comprehensive, in-depth campaign to boost your image will certainly cost you some dough, but judging from your situation, it could be the one thing keeping you from prison. Hire a well-known public relations agency – they know exactly how best to convey your message to your audience.
type_data.label: Broad image campaign
type_data.title: Broad/major/comprehensive/all-round image campaign

type_data.description: Some of your entries on Wikipedia could really end up harming your reputation. Those wise guys actually think they’ve got one on you. They may be right – but your rewrite makes you sound so much better. Just try to be as unobtrusive as possible.
type_data.label: Manipulate Wikipedia
type_data.title: Manipulate Wikipedia

type_data.description: Sensitive internal documents about your activities have been leaked to the public? Oops – seems like you got a taste of your own medicine. Tough luck!
type_data.label: Data Leak
type_data.title: Data Leak

type_data.description: A small group of unrelenting privacy advocates has succeeded in inciting the populace against you. You've been a little careless lately and did too much risky trading.
type_data.label: Protests against data abuse
type_data.title: Protests against data abuse

type_data.description: Some jokers online are sharing insipid pics that make you look rather bad – filled with nasty falsehoods that are really inconvenient. Too bad those pictures spread so fast. Guess it’s high time you do something about it…
type_data.label: Insulting memes
type_data.title: Insulting memes

type_data.description: There’s this one strange guy that’s been annoying you for a while. Seems like he’s gotten his teeth into you for some reason. Now he clings to you like a lamprey and keeps on criticizing the glorious deals you’re making. He really needs to get a life – and learn how to keep his mouth shut.
type_data.label: Annoying privacy guy
type_data.title: Annoying privacy guy

type_data.description: Seems like you went too far this time, and this is what you get for it. Congress and media are discussing new privacy regulations that could have dire consequences for your business. High time you acted to ensure those regulations are worded a little more favourably.
type_data.label: Data privacy regulations
type_data.title: Data privacy regulations

type_data.description: Damn! Media are poking around things that are none of their business. And putting it on the front page too! This is not going to be cheap. Let’s hope the next humanitarian crisis will wipe this off everyone’s radar soon.
type_data.label: Bad press
type_data.title: Bad press

type_data.description: Holy crap! Left things a little too long, huh? The internet is boiling over with wrong accusations, and throusands of angry postings have caused a veritable storm of outrage to be unleashed against you. Duck and cover would be your best strategy – who knows, it might blow over soon.
type_data.label: Shitstorm
type_data.title: Shitstorm

type_data.description: Well, damn. A former employee has copied all the dirty details of your secret dealings and is sharing them all over the media. You need to shut that guy up, and fast! Pull out all the stops – threaten him with legal action, paint him as an untrustworthy traitor to mankind, put pressure on his family and friends. You can do it!
type_data.label: Whistleblower
type_data.title: Whistleblower

type_data.description: Angry users complaining online? Man, don’t they have anything else do to? Can’t they just leave you and your thriving business alone? Still, you better pay some attention, before things get out of hand and they unleash a full-blown shitstorm.
type_data.label: Angry users
type_data.title: Angry users

type_data.description: Your first mission! Click on Jessica, feed her some cash and soon you’ll collect your first profiles! Neat!
type_data.title: First Profiles

tutorial.description: Hey there! My name’s Marco, and I’ll be your personal advisor. Ready?
tutorial.name: tut01: willkommen

tutorial.description: I’ll guide you on your way to become a mighty Data Dealer! Just think of me as a Big Brother.
tutorial.name: tut02: willkommen 2

tutorial.description: This is your database. Ready for millions of high-class personality profiles.
tutorial.name: tut03: datenbank perp

tutorial.description: Your data empire needs a homebase, and Little Rock is just the place. Why? We’ll discuss that later.
tutorial.name: tut04: first city

tutorial.description: Let’s take a look inside your database first.
tutorial.name: tut05: first city 2

tutorial.description:
This is what’s inside your database.
Lots of space to fill!
tutorial.name: tut06: datenbank leer

tutorial.description: To get you started, here's a neat DVD chock full of yummy phone book data. Just look at it go!
tutorial.name: tut07: telefonbuch integrieren

tutorial.description:
Well, that’s an improvement. Look, up there, on the left: 100,000 profiles!
That's a solid foundation!
tutorial.name: tut08: telefonbuch integrieren 2

tutorial.description: Now on with your future empire. 100,000 names, addresses and phone numbers are nice and all, but you really need some more delicate info.
tutorial.name: tut09: back in imperium

tutorial.description: May I introduce: Manny Mayer, private detective and an old friend. Had some big successes a while back, but those golden years are long gone now.
tutorial.name: tut10: manny 1

tutorial.description: Underpaid, bored and hungry for action, Manny has become a big-time expert in tracking down small-time sources…
tutorial.name: tut11: manny 2

tutorial.description: ...especially those who handle personal data! Like Jessica Seno, a low-level clerk in a big-ass casino.
tutorial.name: tut12: manny kennt jessica

tutorial.description: As luck would have it, Jessica is also underpaid, bored and hungry for action. And she has full access to the casino’s central computer. Nice!
tutorial.name: tut13: jessica 1

tutorial.description: Send a little cash her way now and then, and she’ll supply you with interesting info on people who regularly gamble away their paycheck.
tutorial.name: tut14: jessica 2

type_data.description: New mission! Enter your database and integrate the new profiles you got from Jessica. Hint: Check the conveyor at the bottom left.
type_data.title: Enter the Vault!

type_data.description: New mission! Sell your data – click on the car company and make your first deal.
type_data.title: Rookie Dealer

tutorial.description: You've already learned 8 different things about more than 100,000 people! Yeah!
tutorial.name: Vor Mission 3 (1): Datenbank

tutorial.description: Back to your empire. Your data is worth its weight in gold. You should sell it. But to whom?
tutorial.name: Vor Mission 3 (2): Verkaufen

tutorial.description: This is Denise. She’s a pro and procures new clients for you who are very keen to get their hands on your data.
tutorial.name: Vor Mission 3 (3): Denise

tutorial.description: Let’s take this car company for example. They’d be really interested in the names and addresses of gullible people…
tutorial.name: Vor Mission 3 (4): Autohändler

tutorial.description: …who will fall for their super-cheap offers in those glossy brochures. You know, deals that later turn out not to be that cheap after all.
tutorial.name: Vor Mission 3 (4): Autohändler 2

type_data.description: New mission! There’s lots of profiles to gain with a raffle. Click on your bogus company and start sweepstakes!
type_data.title: You’re a winner!

tutorial.description: Don't just rely on others to get you some new data sources. Get active and start up your own data collection agency.
tutorial.name: Vor Mission 4 (1): Intro

tutorial.description: But first you need to set up a letterbox company. Your dealings are a little dodgy sometimes? Better use a bogus company for camouflage.
tutorial.name: Vor Mission 4 (2): Briefkastenfirma

type_data.description: New mission! Sealed your first deal? Collect at least $500 from the car company for the data sold.
type_data.title: Cash in!

type_data.description: New mission! Upgrade your raffle, advertise, and expand your team! Get more profiles in the same time!
type_data.title: Upgrade raffle

type_data.description: New mission! Recruit Nurse Helen and get her to pass you 3,000 patient records for your database.
type_data.title: Nurse Helen

type_data.description: New mission! Click on Sex and use your collected first names to calculate the sex of previously unclassified profiles.
type_data.title: Database machine

tutorial.description: Hint: Attributes with a little cog in the upper right corner offer rather special opportunities.
tutorial.name: Vor Mission 8 Geschlecht (1)

tutorial.description: Let’s take sex for example: You can analyse the first names you’ve collected and use them to calculate people’s sex.
tutorial.name: Vor Mission 8 Geschlecht (2)

type_data.description: New mission! Click on Denise and make a deal with the insurance company. You need the money! And ask Manny about Alexa.
type_data.title: Sick World

type_data.description: New mission! Get data from at least 10,000 people on how naive they are. Then sell that data to the car company.
type_data.title: So green!

type_data.description: New mission! Click on your bogus company, get the personality test, and upgrade it with „How faithful are you?“.
type_data.title: Psycho

type_data.description: New mission! Get data on 6000 people showing whether they’re slackers or not and sell it to the insurance company.
type_data.title: Couch Potato

type_data.description: New mission! Click on Denise, aquire new customers and collect at least $2000!
type_data.title: Employee Monitoring

type_data.description: New mission! Collecting profiles is quite risky. Promote the personality test and hire a lawyer to lower your risk.
type_data.title: Improve your image

type_data.description: New mission! Click on Little Rock and recruit Heidi Plum. Doesn’t come cheap, but she’s got excellent contacts.
type_data.title: Unofficial collaboration

type_data.description: New mission! Click on Little Rock, recruit Alfonso, and he’ll procure lots of lucrative customers for your data!
type_data.title: Alfonso

type_data.description: New mission! Reach Level 9, click on Little Rock and get a second bogus company so you can start additional ventures.
type_data.title: Bogus company tangle

type_data.description: New mission! Enter your database, buy the expansion Body Mass Index and start your calculations.
type_data.title: Multiplication 101

type_data.description: New mission! Reach Level 11, click on Little Rock and expand to New York City. Your target group will multiply tenfold!
type_data.title: Big Apple, Big Data!

type_data.text: New customers - perfect! Hint: Take a look at what data Edu Inc is especially interested in and collect more of it.
New customers – perfect! Click on them right away and make a deal. You need more money for your empire!
Yeah, your new office in New York City is all set up! Click on it right away and get new bogus companies, agents and brokers for your empire!
By the way: Your customers will pay you more if you can offer them more of the desired data.
Alfonso is the bomb! Click on him and check whether he has procured a profitable data source for you.

type_data.description: He had a few big cases a decade ago, but the good old days are over. Underpaid, bored and hungry for action, Manny has become quite the expert in sniffing out low-level clerks who have daily access to some fairly personal data. Offer a little cash, and they’ll get you some tasty bits and pieces for your database in return.
type_data.label: Manny Mayer
type_data.subtitle: is a private detective and an old friend
type_data.title: Manny Mayer

type_data.description: You’ve never met her in person. Any contact you have is initiated by her. Loft is a phantom, and yet one of your most valuable resources. She’s in contact with some shadowy circles where large packets of delicate data are sold for a song. Even the big companies - eventually, someone always gets in and sneaks out with something worth selling.
type_data.label: Mara Loft
type_data.subtitle: knows the hacker world inside out
type_data.title: Mara Loft

type_data.description: Everybody’s darling on TV and all other media – those were the days. Ever since she beat up a 12-year old contestant on her live TV show, she’s been out of the picture. However, she still has good contacts, some of whom wouldn’t mind a cash boost and could offer you access to some delicate data.
type_data.label: Heidi Plum
type_data.subtitle: Knows how to play the media
type_data.title: Heidi Plum

type_data.description: Whether they’re politicians or bureaucrats, serve on boards or with the police: Barnie Maddog knows them all. Or knows someone who does. After all, he used to be a very important man. Those days may be long gone, but he can still hook you up with interesting people who have access to some especially juicy tidbits.
type_data.label: Barnie Maddog
type_data.subtitle: knows all the political bigwigs
type_data.title: Barnie Maddog

type_data.description: Little Rock may not be the center of the world, but it makes a pretty good operational base. It’s already home to another data collection company, in fact. From here you can easily expand your empire, control your bogus companies and stay in touch with your network.
type_data.label: Little Rock
type_data.title: Little Rock

type_data.description: New York isn’t exactly cheap, but the perfect location for your second office nonetheless! The Big Apple is where it all comes together. By expanding to New York, your catchment area increases to 40 million people, which means: More profiles for you! From here you control your bogus companies and stay in touch with your network.
type_data.label: New York City

story.text: Yeah, your new office in New York City is all set up! Click on it right away and get new bogus companies, agents and brokers for your empire!

type_data.title: New York City

type_data.description: Great coverage, low deductible, of course they all want our policy! People are terrified of what could happen if worse came to worst, so we can be choosy. But treating some diseases costs us a pretty penny, and we’d rather avoid that. Before we take on someone new, we need information, like pre-existing conditions and risky behaviors, so we can decide how much we’ll make them pay for the honor.
type_data.label:
Health Insurance
Company
type_data.requirements_text: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.

story.text: New customers – perfect! Click on them right away and make a deal. You need more money for your empire!

type_data.title: Health Insurance

type_data.description: Placid, quiet, orderly – that’s how we like things around here. And we intend to keep them this way. So we need to act quickly to prevent rowdies, punks and other hooligans from gaining a foothold in our beautiful city. And as for political and religious fanatics, we need to keep a watchful eye on them too – you can’t be too careful with those people!
type_data.label: City Council
type_data.requirements_text: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.

story.text: New customers - perfect! Hint: You should always have a few deals on the go to bring in the money.

type_data.title: City Council

type_data.description: With almost 2 million employees, we’re one of the country’s biggest employers. Consequently, our human resources department needs to process thousands of applications every year, ranging from apprentices to managers. We need some background information on our current and future employees so we can sort out the bad eggs more easily.
type_data.label: Star Mart
type_data.requirements_text: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.

story.text: By the way: Your customers will pay you more if you can offer them more of the desired data.

type_data.title: Star Mart

type_data.description: Car leasing, what a gold mine! Our ads are filled with super-cheap offers, so people think our cars cost next to nothing. Luckily no one bothers to read the small print, because that’s where we hide the real costs. What we really need are the names and addresses of particularly gullible people that are likely to be taken in by our offers, so we can send them our shiny brochures and wait for them to take the bait.
type_data.label: Car company
type_data.requirements_text: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.
type_data.title: Car company

type_data.description: First off, we don’t need any riffraff at our school. Second, no harm knowing a little about what our students are up to in their free time. Mental problems? Smoking? Playing video games all night? Good to know. Our schools have a reputation to protect!
type_data.label: Edu Inc
type_data.requirements_text: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.

story.text: New customers - perfect! Hint: Take a look at what data Edu Inc is especially interested in and collect more of it.

type_data.title: Edu Inc

type_data.description: We sell toys. All kinds of toys. Toys for babies, toys for teens. And we need the addresses of parents. Or parents-to-be. Ideally parents who only want what’s best for their kids. And what is best for their kids? Why, our products of course! And get us those parents who won’t just trash our brochures – get us those who’ll buy.
type_data.label: Toys ´R´ Nice
type_data.requirements_text: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.
type_data.title: Toys ´R´ Nice

type_data.description: It used to be so easy: Every year we created another cookie-cutter superstar, produced a few hits and made millions. But every since those MP3s appeared, everything’s gone to hell. No one buys our pricey CDs anymore! Instead, every child now knows how to download songs off the net. If only we could track all those copyright infringers, we’d sue them and get our money that way...
type_data.label: Major Label
type_data.requirements_text: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.
type_data.title: Major Label

type_data.description: Our establishment doesn’t just give out accounts to anyone. And loans? Don’t make me laugh. Even when we do, there’s still the question of what it will cost each client. To make this kind of decision, we need EVERY bit of info that can help us assess current and potential customers and decide who to blacklist (and who to woo). Doesn't matter whether those predictions hold true in every case, as long as we make a tidy profit.
type_data.label: Bank
type_data.requirements_text: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.
type_data.title: Bank

type_data.description: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.
type_data.label: Company.Com
type_data.requirements_text: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.
type_data.title: Company.Com

type_data.description: Our members own a plenty of houses and apartments – and they would really like to “get to know“ their new tenants a little better before they move in. People who live beyond their means or – heaven forbid – are in debt are out of the question anyway. And some want nothing else but boring hetero couples without pets, kids or drugs. Everyone else can very kindly piss off.
type_data.label: National Rental Housing
type_data.requirements_text: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.
type_data.title: National Rental Housing

type_data.description: Nurse Helen works at the county’s largest hospital. For 20 years she’s slaved away in the sick ward. Now her hours have been increased and her wages cut. Incidentally, she’s got full access to the hospital’s central database. She needs the money, and would be willing to supply you with reliable data on her patients’ health status.
type_data.label: Nurse Helen
type_data.title: Nurse Helen

type_data.description: He calls himself Uncle Enzo and claims to have hacked into the online network of a global game console provider. Says it was pretty easy, too. He’s not just offering names and addresses, but passwords, credit card numbers and game lists. All in all, he’s sitting on almost a million data sets for your country alone – you really need to get your hands on those!
type_data.label: Uncle Enzo
type_data.title: Uncle Enzo

type_data.description: For thirty years, Paul Peeves has done foreclosures and he grew sick long ago of visiting those poor, heavily indebted bastards, hauling away their TVs, computers and cars. No surprise he’s turned a little cynical (can you say “burnout”?) If you soothe his pain with a few bucks, he’ll gladly send you the details on his “customers” - and those of a few associates as well.
type_data.label: Paul Peeves
type_data.title: Paul Peeves

type_data.description: Beverly Compton-Burr works at the Department of Education and heads the division that manages the fancy new central student database – storing all the minute details of each and every student file, to “simplify administration.” She earns good money, but she may have gotten in a little over her head with that new penthouse suite...
type_data.label:
Beverly
Compton-Burr
type_data.title: Beverly Compton-Burr

type_data.description: Sadik attends at least 10 events every night, taking rapid fire photos without rest. Of course he makes sure to get the email addresses of the over-illuminated subjects of his pictures – so he can send them the photos! Then he spends the rest of the night uploading everything to a party photo site. Too bad they don’t pay so well. At least he has full access to each and every picture on site.
type_data.label: Sadik Guerrero
type_data.title: Sadik Guerrero

type_data.description: Lennon has been a youth worker at the local center for years. He started out motivated and badly paid – now the bad pay is all that remains. He recently started using a program common to many youth centers across the country. It logs all sorts of data about the teens frequenting the center – whether they’ve got a criminal record, whether they smoke, that kind of thing. Sounds handy, right?
type_data.label: Lennon Che Ramirez
type_data.title:
Lennon Che
Ramirez

type_data.description: Alexa is a personal trainer at a popular nationwide fitness chain. Ten years ago she had her moment in the limelight, even had her own DVD. But those days are long gone, and spandex stardom is a faded memory. Thankfully, she has admin access to the chain's database, which stores everything from attendance records to health details from members' wellness and nutrition counseling.
type_data.label: Alexa C. Tivia
type_data.title: Alexa C. Tivia

type_data.description: Riley delivers pizza for one of those big fast food chains. Quite stressful, that. By now she knows what her regulars usually want. Four beers and a quattro formaggio with extra cheese every day? Or a once-in-a-while salad pizza and still water? She recently started receiving those orders straight to her smartphone – so she can always keep track of what’s waiting for her at the next address.
type_data.label: Riley V. Red
type_data.title: Riley V. Red

type_data.description: Elly works at a public library which is connected to a nationwide network. The new computer system they recently had installed collects very detailed information on each and every loan. Not only can Elly search who borrowed which books and for how long – she can print off whole lists of that sort! Pretty sweet!
type_data.label: Elly DeTelly
type_data.title: Elly DeTelly

type_data.description: Hana works for a large publishing house distributing hundreds of newspapers and magazines. Yeah, one of the real big ones. That means she has access to some comprehensive subscription lists – everything from Lonely Hearts Gazette to Guinea Pig Monthly and MAD Management Mag. There must be something in there you can use – so don’t let this opportunity pass you by.
type_data.label: Hana Blum
type_data.title: Hana Blum

type_data.description: Jessica works at the city’s largest casino, and it’s a complete drag. Once people get started with roulette, poker or slot machines, there’s no end in sight until they’re flat broke. Security is essential, so every guest is logged. Seeing those poor bastards gamble away more money than she’s ever going to earn has made Jessica somewhat cynical, so if you send a little sugar her way, she’ll let you know who the regulars are.
type_data.label: Jessica Seno
type_data.title: Jessica Seno

type_data.description: This text part of this beautiful game item is currently being reviewed by our amazing editorial team. It will become available here shortly. Thanks for your understanding.
type_data.label: Database
type_data.title: Database

type_data.text: New customers - perfect! Hint: You should always have a few deals on the go to bring in the money.

type_data.description:
Dangle a big fat carrot in front of their nose and they won’t be able to resist!
You can rake in the info with an attractive sweepstakes prize.
The hotter the ticket, the more suckers will go for it!
type_data.label: Sweepstakes

story.text: Your first venture, yeah! Hint: To make sure your raffle collects lots of data you need to invest some money first.

type_data.title: Sweepstakes

type_data.description: For the chance to find their soulmate, lonely souls will pour out their hearts to you, and let you in on their deepest secrets. Once you line up email-addresses and pseudonyms with the real names, things start to get interesting.
type_data.label: Dating Site
type_data.title: Dating Site

type_data.description: Everyone loves online personality tests! And with their help, you can create detailed character profiles. Of course, to see the premium analysis of their laboriously filled out tests, participants just need to enter a few personal details...
type_data.label: Personality Tests

story.text: Good job! Hint: If you upgrade the personality test and the raffle, you’ll get more profiles and maybe even additional attributes.

type_data.title: Personality Tests

type_data.description: Tell me what you buy, and I’ll tell you who you are! Operate your loyalty card scheme for supermarkets, gas stations, furniture stores or fitness studios. Special offers for club members draw shoppers like moths, and you learn everything about their purchases.
type_data.label: Club Cards
type_data.title: Club Cards

type_data.description: Why do things the hard way? Just call people up and get all that lucrative information directly from their mouths! Just introduce yourself as a reputable market research institute, say you just have a few discreet questions. The more specific and convincing you make your calls, the better results this kind of phone terrorizing will get you.
type_data.label:
Telephone
survey

story.text: Those nuisance calls do take some time, but every time you invest, you get more than 10.000 profiles, even more if you have upgrades!

type_data.title: Telephone survey

type_data.description: Know those elegant cards usually enclosed with products, especially the more expensive ones? Many people dutifully fill them out and send them in, thinking this will get them special treatment if something should break. However, the manufacturer never sees those cards – they go straight to you. In turn, you’re responsible for evaluation.
type_data.label: Warranty Cards
type_data.title: Warranty Cards

type_data.description:
People staying loyal to their favorite brands are real cash cows. What do they pay for? Nothing? And how much? Lots more! First of all, they’ll happily pay ten times a similar product without the shiny logo would cost. And second, they keep on buying the same brand. This especially applies to teenagers – perfect!

For this reason, a whole slew of companies nowadays sell one thing, and one thing only: Their logo. Not much else they have to offer, really. And what do they need? The suckers' names and addresses. So give them what they ask for – just do it!
